rev.comment: reveting unexplained removal of content, but I agree this can be "toned down"
rev.diff:
Line 52: Line 52:
==== Mac OS X 10.7 "Lion" ====
==== Mac OS X 10.7 "Lion" ====
â
As soon as Mac OS X Lion was released (July 20, 2011)<ref>{{cite web|last=Slivka|first=Eric|title=Apple Launches OS X Lion Via Mac App Store|url=http://www.macrumors.com/2011/07/20/apple-launches-os-x-lion-via-mac-app-store/|publisher=Macrumors|accessdate=21 July 2011}}</ref>; the community of Hackintosh users, figured out a way to install the retail Lion App on any Intel Core 2 or above, 64 bit CPU. OS X 10.7 Lion can be installed on any Supported Intel Core 2 or Core i based PC, by moving the Lion app to a partitioned drive and booting from it using Chameleon. The osx86 community is dedicated to running on Intel hardware via retail guides only.
+
As soon as Mac OS X Lion was released (July 20, 2011)<ref>{{cite web|last=Slivka|first=Eric|title=Apple Launches OS X Lion Via Mac App Store|url=http://www.macrumors.com/2011/07/20/apple-launches-os-x-lion-via-mac-app-store/|publisher=Macrumors|accessdate=21 July 2011}}</ref>; tonymacx86, founder of the [http://www.tonymacx86.com/ www.tonymacx86.com] community of Hackintosh users, figured out a way to use the retail Lion App to install on any Intel Core 2 or above, 64 bit CPU. The method, called xMove<ref>{{cite web|first=Tony|title=xMove + MultiBeast: Install OS X 10.7 Lion on any Supported Intel Core 2 or Core i based PC|url=http://tonymacx86.blogspot.com/2011/07/xmove-multibeast-install-os-x-107-lion.html|publisher=Tonymacx86 Blog|accessdate=21 July 2011}}</ref>, boots a moved install of the official App purchased from the Mac App Store to a partitioned drive so that it can then be booted with Chimera. The tonymacx86 community is dedicated to running on Intel hardware via retail guides only.
===Boot loaders and emulators===
===Boot loaders and emulators===
